   20: -module(logger_std_h_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("kernel/include/logger.hrl").
   26: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_internal.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_h_common.hrl").
   28: -include_lib("kernel/src/logger_olp.hrl").
   29: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").
   30: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   31: 
   32: -define(check_no_log,
   33:         begin
   34:             timer:sleep(?IDLE_DETECT_TIME*2),
   35:             [] = test_server:messages_get()
   36:         end).
   37: -define(check(Expected),
   38:         receive
   39:             {log,Expected} ->
   40:                 [] = test_server:messages_get()
   41:         after 5000 ->
   42:                 ct:fail({report_not_received,
   43:                          {line,?LINE},
   44:                          {expected,Expected},
   45:                          {got,test_server:messages_get()}})
   46:         end).
   47: 
   48: -define(msg,"Log from "++atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)++
   49:             ":"++integer_to_list(?LINE)).
   50: -define(bin(Msg), list_to_binary(Msg++"\n")).
   51: -define(domain,#{domain=>[?MODULE]}).
   52: 
   53: suite() ->
   54:     [{timetrap,{seconds,30}}].
   55: 
   56: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   57:     timer:start(),                              % to avoid progress report
   58:     {ok,#{formatter:=OrigFormatter}} =
   59:         logger:get_handler_config(?STANDARD_HANDLER),
   60:     [{formatter,OrigFormatter}|Config].
   61: 
   62: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   63:     {OrigMod,OrigConf} = proplists:get_value(formatter,Config),
   64:     logger:set_handler_config(?STANDARD_HANDLER,formatter,{OrigMod,OrigConf}),
   65:     ok.
   66: 
   67: init_per_group(_Group, Config) ->
   68:     Config.
   69: 
   70: end_per_group(_Group, _Config) ->
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: init_per_testcase(reopen_changed_log=TC, Config) ->
   74:     case os:type() of
   75:         {win32,_} ->
   76:             {skip,"This test can only work with inodes, i.e. not on Windows"};
   77:         _ ->
   78:             ct:print("********** ~w **********", [TC]),
   79:             Config
   80:     end;
   81: init_per_testcase(TestHooksCase, Config) when
   82:       TestHooksCase == write_failure;
   83:       TestHooksCase == sync_failure ->
   84:     case (fun() -> ?TEST_HOOKS_TAB == undefined end)() of
   85:         true ->
   86:             {skip,"Define the TEST_HOOKS macro to run this test"};
   87:         false ->
   88:             ct:print("********** ~w **********", [TestHooksCase]),
   89:             Config
   90:     end;
   91: init_per_testcase(OPCase, Config) when
   92:       OPCase == qlen_kill_new;
   93:       OPCase == restart_after ->
   94:     case re:run(erlang:system_info(system_version),
   95:                 "dirty-schedulers-TEST",
   96:                 [{capture,none}]) of
   97:         match ->
   98:             {skip,"Overload protection test skipped on dirty-schedulers-TEST"};
   99:         nomatch ->
  100:             ct:print("********** ~w **********", [OPCase]),
  101:             Config
  102:     end;
  103: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  104:     ct:print("********** ~w **********", [TestCase]),
  105:     Config.
  106: 
  107: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  108:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
  109:     catch error:undef -> ok
  110:     end,
  111:     ok.
  112: 
  113: groups() ->
  114:     [].
  115: 
  116: all() -> 
  117:     [add_remove_instance_tty,
  118:      add_remove_instance_standard_io,
  119:      add_remove_instance_standard_error,
  120:      add_remove_instance_custom_device,
  121:      add_remove_instance_file1,
  122:      add_remove_instance_file2,
  123:      add_remove_instance_file3,
  124:      add_remove_instance_file4,
  125:      default_formatter,
  126:      filter_config,
  127:      errors,
  128:      formatter_fail,
  129:      config_fail,
  130:      crash_std_h_to_file,
  131:      crash_std_h_to_disk_log,
  132:      bad_input,
  133:      reconfig,
  134:      file_opts,
  135:      relative_file_path,
  136:      sync,
  137:      write_failure,
  138:      sync_failure,
  139:      op_switch_to_sync_file,
  140:      op_switch_to_sync_tty,
  141:      op_switch_to_drop_file,
  142:      op_switch_to_drop_tty,
  143:      op_switch_to_flush_file,
  144:      op_switch_to_flush_tty,
  145:      limit_burst_disabled,
  146:      limit_burst_enabled_one,
  147:      limit_burst_enabled_period,
  148:      kill_disabled,
  149:      qlen_kill_new,
  150:      qlen_kill_std,
  151:      mem_kill_new,
  152:      mem_kill_std,
  153:      restart_after,
  154:      handler_requests_under_load,
  155:      recreate_deleted_log,
  156:      reopen_changed_log,
  157:      rotate_size,
  158:      rotate_size_compressed,
  159:      rotate_size_reopen,
  160:      rotate_on_start_compressed,
  161:      rotation_opts,
  162:      rotation_opts_restart_handler
  163:     ].
  164: 
  165: add_remove_instance_tty(_Config) ->
  166:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_config,logger_std_h,#{type:=tty}}}} =
  167:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  168:                            #{config => #{type => tty},
  169:                              filter_default=>log,
  170:                              formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  171:     ok.
  172: 
  173: add_remove_instance_standard_io(_Config) ->
  174:     add_remove_instance_nofile(standard_io).
  175: add_remove_instance_standard_io(cleanup,_Config) ->
  176:     logger_std_h_remove().
  177: 
  178: add_remove_instance_custom_device(_Config) ->
  179:     add_remove_instance_nofile({device,user}).
  180: add_remove_instance_custom_device(cleanup,_Config) ->
  181:     logger_std_h_remove().
  182: 
  183: add_remove_instance_standard_error(_Config) ->
  184:     add_remove_instance_nofile(standard_error).
  185: add_remove_instance_standard_error(cleanup,_Config) ->
  186:     logger_std_h_remove().
  187: 
  188: add_remove_instance_file1(Config) ->
  189:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  190:     Log = filename:join(Dir,"stdlog1.txt"),
  191:     Type = {file,Log},
  192:     add_remove_instance_file(Log, Type).
  193: add_remove_instance_file1(cleanup,_Config) ->
  194:     logger_std_h_remove().
  195: 
  196: add_remove_instance_file2(Config) ->
  197:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  198:     Log = filename:join(Dir,"stdlog2.txt"),
  199:     Type = {file,Log,[raw,append]},
  200:     add_remove_instance_file(Log, Type).
  201: add_remove_instance_file2(cleanup,_Config) ->
  202:     logger_std_h_remove().
  203: 
  204: add_remove_instance_file3(_Config) ->
  205:     Log = atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  206:     StdHConfig = #{type=>file},
  207:     add_remove_instance_file(Log, StdHConfig).
  208: add_remove_instance_file3(cleanup,_Config) ->
  209:     logger_std_h_remove().
  210: 
  211: add_remove_instance_file4(Config) ->
  212:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  213:     Log = filename:join(Dir,"stdlog4.txt"),
  214:     StdHConfig = #{file=>Log,modes=>[]},
  215:     add_remove_instance_file(Log, StdHConfig).
  216: add_remove_instance_file4(cleanup,_Config) ->
  217:     logger_std_h_remove().
  218: 
  219: add_remove_instance_file(Log, Type) when not is_map(Type) ->
  220:     add_remove_instance_file(Log,#{type=>Type});
  221: add_remove_instance_file(Log, StdHConfig) when is_map(StdHConfig) ->
  222:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  223:                             logger_std_h,
  224:                             #{config => StdHConfig,
  225:                               filter_default=>stop,
  226:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  227:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  228:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name()),
  229:     true = is_pid(Pid),
  230:     logger:notice(M1=?msg,?domain),
  231:     ?check(M1),
  232:     B1 = ?bin(M1),
  233:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,B1}, filesync_rep_int()),
  234:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  235:     timer:sleep(500),
  236:     undefined = whereis(h_proc_name()),
  237:     logger:notice(?msg,?domain),
  238:     ?check_no_log,
  239:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,B1}, filesync_rep_int()),
  240:     ok.
  241: 
  242: default_formatter(_Config) ->
  243:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?STANDARD_HANDLER,formatter,
  244:                                    {?DEFAULT_FORMATTER,?DEFAULT_FORMAT_CONFIG}),
  245:     ct:capture_start(),
  246:     logger:notice(M1=?msg),
  247:     timer:sleep(100),
  248:     ct:capture_stop(),
  249:     [Msg] = ct:capture_get(),
  250:     match = re:run(Msg,"=NOTICE REPORT====.*\n"++M1,[{capture,none}]),
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: filter_config(_Config) ->
  254:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,#{}),
  255:     {ok,#{config:=HConfig}=Config} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  256:     HConfig = maps:without([olp],HConfig),
  257: 
  258:     FakeFullHConfig = HConfig#{olp=>{regname,self(),erlang:make_ref()}},
  259:     #{config:=HConfig} =
  260:         logger_std_h:filter_config(Config#{config=>FakeFullHConfig}),
  261:     ok.
  262: 
  263: filter_config(cleanup,_Config) ->
  264:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  265:     ok.
  266: 
  267: errors(Config) ->
  268:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  269:     Log = filename:join(Dir,?FUNCTION_NAME),
  270: 
  271:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,#{}),
  272:     {error,{already_exist,?MODULE}} =
  273:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,#{}),
  274:     
  275:     {error,{not_found,no_such_name}} = logger:remove_handler(no_such_name),
  276: 
  277:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  278:     {error,{not_found,?MODULE}} = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  279: 
  280:     {error,
  281:      {handler_not_added,
  282:       {invalid_config,logger_std_h,#{type:=faulty_type}}}} =
  283:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  284:                            #{config => #{type => faulty_type}}),
  285: 
  286:     case os:type() of
  287:         {win32,_} ->
  288:             %% No use in testing file access on windows
  289:             ok;
  290:         _ ->
  291:             NoDir = lists:concat(["/",?MODULE,"_dir"]),
  292:             {error,
  293:              {handler_not_added,{open_failed,NoDir,Error}}} =
  294:                 logger:add_handler(myh2,logger_std_h,
  295:                                    #{config=>#{type=>{file,NoDir}}}),
  296:             case Error of
  297:                 erofs ->
  298:                     %% Happens on OS X
  299:                     ok;
  300:                 eacces ->
  301:                     ok
  302:             end
  303:     end,
  304: 
  305:     {error,
  306:      {handler_not_added,
  307:       {invalid_config,logger_std_h,#{modes:=bad_file_opt}}}} =
  308:         logger:add_handler(myh3,logger_std_h,
  309:                            #{config=>#{type=>{file,Log,bad_file_opt}}}),
  310: 
  311:     ok = logger:notice(?msg).
  312: 
  313: errors(cleanup,_Config) ->
  314:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  315: 
  316: formatter_fail(Config) ->
  317:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  318:     Log = filename:join(Dir,?FUNCTION_NAME),
  319: 
  320:     logger:set_primary_config(level,notice),
  321: 
  322:     %% no formatter
  323:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  324:                             logger_std_h,
  325:                             #{config => #{type => {file,Log}},
  326:                               filter_default=>stop,
  327:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE])}),
  328:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name()),
  329:     true = is_pid(Pid),
  330:     H = logger:get_handler_ids(),
  331:     true = lists:member(?MODULE,H),
  332: 
  333:     %% Formatter is added automatically
  334:     {ok,#{formatter:={logger_formatter,_}}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  335:     logger:notice(M1=?msg,?domain),
  336:     Got1 = try_match_file(Log,"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: "++M1,5000),
  337: 
  338:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,formatter,{nonexistingmodule,#{}}),
  339:     logger:notice(M2=?msg,?domain),
  340:     Got2 = try_match_file(Log,
  341:                           escape(Got1)++"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: FORMATTER CRASH: .*"++M2,
  342:                           5000),
  343: 
  344:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,formatter,{?MODULE,crash}),
  345:     logger:notice(M3=?msg,?domain),
  346:     Got3 = try_match_file(Log,
  347:                           escape(Got2)++"[0-9\\+\\-T:\\.]* notice: FORMATTER CRASH: .*"++M3,
  348:                           5000),
  349: 
  350:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,formatter,{?MODULE,bad_return}),
  351:     logger:notice(?msg,?domain),
  352:     try_match_file(Log,
  353:                    escape(Got3)++"FORMATTER ERROR: bad return value",
  354:                    5000),
  355: 
  356:     %% Check that handler is still alive and was never dead
  357:     Pid = whereis(h_proc_name()),
  358:     H = logger:get_handler_ids(),
  359: 
  360:     ok.
  361: 
  362: formatter_fail(cleanup,_Config) ->
  363:     logger:set_primary_config(level,info),
  364:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  365: 
  366: config_fail(_Config) ->
  367:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_config,logger_std_h,#{bad:=bad}}}} =
  368:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  369:                            #{config => #{bad => bad},
  370:                              filter_default=>log,
  371:                              formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  372:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_config,logger_std_h,
  373:                                #{restart_type:=bad}}}} =
  374:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  375:                            #{config => #{restart_type => bad},
  376:                              filter_default=>log,
  377:                              formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  378:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{drop_mode_qlen:=1}}}} =
  379:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  380:                            #{config => #{drop_mode_qlen=>1}}),
  381:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{sync_mode_qlen:=43,
  382:                                                     drop_mode_qlen:=42}}}} =
  383:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  384:                            #{config => #{sync_mode_qlen=>43,
  385:                                          drop_mode_qlen=>42}}),
  386:     {error,{handler_not_added,{invalid_olp_levels,#{drop_mode_qlen:=43,
  387:                                                     flush_qlen:=42}}}} =
  388:         logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  389:                            #{config => #{drop_mode_qlen=>43,
  390:                                          flush_qlen=>42}}),
  391: 
  392:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,logger_std_h,
  393:                             #{filter_default=>log,
  394:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  395:     {error,{illegal_config_change,logger_std_h,#{type:=_},#{type:=_}}} =
  396:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,
  397:                                   #{type=>{file,"file"}}),
  398: 
  399:     {error,{invalid_olp_levels,_}} =
  400:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,
  401:                                   #{sync_mode_qlen=>100,
  402:                                     flush_qlen=>99}),
  403:     {error,{invalid_config,logger_std_h,#{filesync_rep_int:=2000}}} =
  404:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  405:                                   #{filesync_rep_int => 2000}),
  406: 
  407:     %% Read-only fields may (accidentally) be included in the change,
  408:     %% but it won't take effect
  409:     {ok,C} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  410:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{olp=>dummyvalue}),
  411:     {ok,C} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  412: 
  413:     ok.
  414: 
  415: config_fail(cleanup,_Config) ->
  416:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  417: 
  418: crash_std_h_to_file(Config) ->
  419:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  420:     Log = filename:join(Dir,lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  421:     crash_std_h(Config,?FUNCTION_NAME,
  422:                 [{handler,default,logger_std_h,
  423:                   #{ config => #{ type => {file, Log} }}}],
  424:                 file, Log).
  425: crash_std_h_to_file(cleanup,_Config) ->
  426:     crash_std_h(cleanup).
  427: 
  428: crash_std_h_to_disk_log(Config) ->
  429:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  430:     Log = filename:join(Dir,lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  431:     crash_std_h(Config,?FUNCTION_NAME,
  432:                 [{handler,default,logger_disk_log_h,
  433:                   #{ config => #{ file => Log }}}],
  434:                 disk_log,Log).
  435: crash_std_h_to_disk_log(cleanup,_Config) ->
  436:     crash_std_h(cleanup).
  437: 
  438: crash_std_h(Config,Func,Var,Type,Log) ->
  439:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  440:     SysConfig = filename:join(Dir,lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",Func,".config"])),
  441:     ok = file:write_file(SysConfig, io_lib:format("[{kernel,[{logger,~p}]}].",[Var])),
  442:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  443:     Name = lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",Func]),
  444:     Args = lists:concat([" -config ",filename:rootname(SysConfig)," -pa ",Pa]),
  445:     ct:pal("Starting ~p with ~tp", [Name,Args]),
  446:     %% Start a node which prints kernel logs to the destination specified by Type
  447:     {ok,Node} = test_server:start_node(Name, peer, [{args, Args}]),
  448:     HProcName =
  449:         case Type of
  450:             file -> ?name_to_reg_name(logger_std_h,?STANDARD_HANDLER);
  451:             disk_log -> ?name_to_reg_name(logger_disk_log_h,?STANDARD_HANDLER)
  452:         end,
  453:     Pid = rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[HProcName]),
  454:     ok = rpc:call(Node,logger,set_handler_config,[?STANDARD_HANDLER,formatter,
  455:                                                   {?MODULE,self()}]),
  456:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node,"dummy1"),
  457:     ?check("dummy1"),
  458:     {ok,Bin1} = sync_and_read(Node,Type,Log),
  459:     <<"dummy1\n">> = binary:part(Bin1,{byte_size(Bin1),-7}),
  460: 
  461:     %% Kill the logger_std_h process
  462:     exit(Pid, kill),
  463: 
  464:     %% Wait a bit, then check that it is gone
  465:     timer:sleep(2000),
  466:     undefined = rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[HProcName]),
  467: 
  468:     %% Check that file is not empty
  469:     {ok,Bin2} = sync_and_read(Node,Type,Log),
  470:     <<"dummy1\n">> = binary:part(Bin2,{byte_size(Bin2),-7}),
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: %% Can not use rpc:call here, since the code would execute on a
  474: %% process with group_leader on this (the calling) node, and thus
  475: %% logger would send the log event to the logger process here instead
  476: %% of logging it itself.
  477: log_on_remote_node(Node,Msg) ->
  478:     Pid = self(),
  479:     _ = spawn_link(Node,
  480:                    fun() -> erlang:group_leader(whereis(user),self()),
  481:                             logger:notice(Msg),
  482:                             Pid ! done
  483:                    end),
  484:     receive done -> ok end,
  485:     ok.
  486: 
  487: 
  488: crash_std_h(cleanup) ->
  489:     Nodes = nodes(),
  490:     [test_server:stop_node(Node) || Node <- Nodes].
  491: 
  492: sync_and_read(Node,disk_log,Log) ->
  493:     rpc:call(Node,logger_disk_log_h,filesync,[?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  494:     case file:read_file(Log ++ ".1") of
  495:         {ok,<<>>} ->
  496:             timer:sleep(5000),
  497:             file:read_file(Log ++ ".1");
  498:         Ok ->
  499:             Ok
  500:     end;
  501: sync_and_read(Node,file,Log) ->
  502:     rpc:call(Node,logger_std_h,filesync,[?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  503:     case file:read_file(Log) of
  504:         {ok,<<>>} ->
  505:             timer:sleep(5000),
  506:             file:read_file(Log);
  507:         Ok ->
  508:             Ok
  509:     end.
  510: 
  511: bad_input(_Config) ->
  512:     {error,{badarg,{filesync,["BadType"]}}} = logger_std_h:filesync("BadType").
  513: 
  514: reconfig(Config) ->
  515:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  516:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  517:                             logger_std_h,
  518:                             #{config => #{type => standard_io},
  519:                               filter_default=>log,
  520:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  521:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  522:     #{%id := ?MODULE,
  523:       cb_state:=#{handler_state := #{type := standard_io,
  524:                                      file_ctrl_pid := FileCtrlPid},
  525:                   filesync_repeat_interval := no_repeat},
  526:       sync_mode_qlen := ?SYNC_MODE_QLEN,
  527:       drop_mode_qlen := ?DROP_MODE_QLEN,
  528:       flush_qlen := ?FLUSH_QLEN,
  529:       burst_limit_enable := ?BURST_LIMIT_ENABLE,
  530:       burst_limit_max_count := ?BURST_LIMIT_MAX_COUNT,
  531:       burst_limit_window_time := ?BURST_LIMIT_WINDOW_TIME,
  532:       overload_kill_enable := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_ENABLE,
  533:       overload_kill_qlen := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_QLEN,
  534:       overload_kill_mem_size := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_MEM_SIZE,
  535:       overload_kill_restart_after := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER} =
  536:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  537: 
  538:     {ok,
  539:      #{config:=
  540:            #{type := standard_io,
  541:              sync_mode_qlen := ?SYNC_MODE_QLEN,
  542:              drop_mode_qlen := ?DROP_MODE_QLEN,
  543:              flush_qlen := ?FLUSH_QLEN,
  544:              burst_limit_enable := ?BURST_LIMIT_ENABLE,
  545:              burst_limit_max_count := ?BURST_LIMIT_MAX_COUNT,
  546:              burst_limit_window_time := ?BURST_LIMIT_WINDOW_TIME,
  547:              overload_kill_enable := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_ENABLE,
  548:              overload_kill_qlen := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_QLEN,
  549:              overload_kill_mem_size := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_MEM_SIZE,
  550:              overload_kill_restart_after := ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
  551:              filesync_repeat_interval := no_repeat} =
  552:            DefaultHConf}}
  553:         = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  554: 
  555:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  556:                                    #{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
  557:                                      drop_mode_qlen => 2,
  558:                                      flush_qlen => 3,
  559:                                      burst_limit_enable => false,
  560:                                      burst_limit_max_count => 10,
  561:                                      burst_limit_window_time => 10,
  562:                                      overload_kill_enable => true,
  563:                                      overload_kill_qlen => 100000,
  564:                                      overload_kill_mem_size => 10000000,
  565:                                      overload_kill_restart_after => infinity,
  566:                                      filesync_repeat_interval => 5000}),
  567:     #{%id := ?MODULE,
  568:       cb_state := #{handler_state := #{type := standard_io,
  569:                                        file_ctrl_pid := FileCtrlPid},
  570:                     filesync_repeat_interval := no_repeat},
  571:       sync_mode_qlen := 1,
  572:       drop_mode_qlen := 2,
  573:       flush_qlen := 3,
  574:       burst_limit_enable := false,
  575:       burst_limit_max_count := 10,
  576:       burst_limit_window_time := 10,
  577:       overload_kill_enable := true,
  578:       overload_kill_qlen := 100000,
  579:       overload_kill_mem_size := 10000000,
  580:       overload_kill_restart_after := infinity} = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  581: 
  582:     {ok,#{config :=
  583:               #{type := standard_io,
  584:                 sync_mode_qlen := 1,
  585:                 drop_mode_qlen := 2,
  586:                 flush_qlen := 3,
  587:                 burst_limit_enable := false,
  588:                 burst_limit_max_count := 10,
  589:                 burst_limit_window_time := 10,
  590:                 overload_kill_enable := true,
  591:                 overload_kill_qlen := 100000,
  592:                 overload_kill_mem_size := 10000000,
  593:                 overload_kill_restart_after := infinity,
  594:                 filesync_repeat_interval := no_repeat} = HConf}} =
  595:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  596: 
  597:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  598:                                       #{flush_qlen => ?FLUSH_QLEN}),
  599:     {ok,#{config:=C1}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  600:     ct:log("C1: ~p",[C1]),
  601:     C1 = HConf#{flush_qlen => ?FLUSH_QLEN},
  602: 
  603:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{sync_mode_qlen => 1}),
  604:     {ok,#{config:=C2}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  605:     ct:log("C2: ~p",[C2]),
  606:     C2 = DefaultHConf#{sync_mode_qlen => 1},
  607: 
  608:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{drop_mode_qlen => 100}),
  609:     {ok,#{config:=C3}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  610:     ct:log("C3: ~p",[C3]),
  611:     C3 = DefaultHConf#{drop_mode_qlen => 100},
  612: 
  613:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config, #{sync_mode_qlen => 1}),
  614:     {ok,#{config:=C4}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  615:     ct:log("C4: ~p",[C4]),
  616:     C4 = DefaultHConf#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
  617:                        drop_mode_qlen => 100},
  618: 
  619:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  620: 
  621:     File = filename:join(Dir,lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  622:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  623:                             logger_std_h,
  624:                             #{config => #{type => {file,File}},
  625:                               filter_default=>log,
  626:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  627:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  628: 
  629:     {ok,#{config:=#{filesync_repeat_interval:=FSI}=FileHConfig}} =
  630:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  631:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,
  632:                                       #{filesync_repeat_interval=>FSI+2000}),
  633:     {ok,#{config:=C5}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  634:     ct:log("C5: ~p",[C5]),
  635:     C5 = FileHConfig#{filesync_repeat_interval=>FSI+2000},
  636: 
  637:     %% You are not allowed to actively set 'type' in runtime, since
  638:     %% this is a write once field.
  639:     {error, {illegal_config_change,logger_std_h,_,_}} =
  640:         logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{type=>standard_io}),
  641:     {ok,#{config:=C6}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  642:     ct:log("C6: ~p",[C6]),
  643:     C6 = C5,
  644: 
  645:     %%  ... but if you don't specify 'type', then set_handler_config shall
  646:     %%  NOT reset it to its default value
  647:     ok = logger:set_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{sync_mode_qlen=>1}),
  648:     {ok,#{config:=C7}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  649:     ct:log("C7: ~p",[C7]),
  650:     C7 = FileHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen=>1},
  651:     ok.
  652: 
  653: reconfig(cleanup, _Config) ->
  654:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  655: 
  656: 
  657: file_opts(Config) ->
  658:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  659:     Log = filename:join(Dir, lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  660:     MissingOpts = [raw],
  661:     Type1 = {file,Log,MissingOpts},
  662:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE, logger_std_h,
  663:                             #{config => #{type => Type1}}),
  664:     {ok,#{config:=#{type:=file,file:=Log,modes:=Modes1}}} =
  665:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  666:     [append,delayed_write,raw] = lists:sort(Modes1),
  667:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  668: 
  669:     OkFileOpts = [raw,append],
  670:     OkType = {file,Log,OkFileOpts},
  671:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  672:                             logger_std_h,
  673:                             #{config => #{type => OkType}, % old format
  674:                               filter_default=>log,
  675:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  676:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  677: 
  678:     ModOpts = [delayed_write|OkFileOpts],
  679:     #{cb_state := #{handler_state := #{type:=file,
  680:                                        file:=Log,
  681:                                        modes:=ModOpts}}} =
  682:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  683:     {ok,#{config := #{type:=file,
  684:                       file:=Log,
  685:                       modes:=ModOpts}}} = logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  686:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  687: 
  688:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  689:                             logger_std_h,
  690:                             #{config => #{type => file,
  691:                                           file => Log,
  692:                                           modes => OkFileOpts}, % new format
  693:                               filter_default=>log,
  694:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  695:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  696: 
  697:     #{cb_state := #{handler_state := #{type:=file,
  698:                                        file:=Log,
  699:                                        modes:=ModOpts}}} =
  700:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  701:     {ok,#{config := #{type:=file,
  702:                       file:=Log,
  703:                       modes:=ModOpts}}} =
  704:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  705:     logger:notice(M1=?msg,?domain),
  706:     ?check(M1),
  707:     B1 = ?bin(M1),
  708:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,B1}, filesync_rep_int()),
  709:     ok.
  710: file_opts(cleanup, _Config) ->
  711:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  712: 
  713: relative_file_path(_Config) ->
  714:     {ok,Dir} = file:get_cwd(),
  715:     AbsName1 = filename:join(Dir,?MODULE),
  716:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  717:                             logger_std_h,
  718:                             #{config => #{type=>file},
  719:                               filter_default=>log,
  720:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  721:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  722:     #{cb_state := #{handler_state := #{file:=AbsName1}}} =
  723:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  724:     {ok,#{config := #{file:=AbsName1}}} =
  725:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  726:     ok = logger:remove_handler(?MODULE),
  727: 
  728:     RelName2 = filename:join(atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME),
  729:                              lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  730:     AbsName2 = filename:join(Dir,RelName2),
  731:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  732:                             logger_std_h,
  733:                             #{config => #{file => RelName2},
  734:                               filter_default=>log,
  735:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  736:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,self()}}),
  737:     #{cb_state := #{handler_state := #{file:=AbsName2}}} =
  738:         logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
  739:     {ok,#{config := #{file:=AbsName2}}} =
  740:         logger:get_handler_config(?MODULE),
  741:     logger:notice(M1=?msg,?domain),
  742:     ?check(M1),
  743:     B1 = ?bin(M1),
  744:     try_read_file(AbsName2, {ok,B1}, filesync_rep_int()),
  745: 
  746:     ok = file:set_cwd(".."),
  747:     logger:notice(M2=?msg,?domain),
  748:     ?check(M2),
  749:     B20 = ?bin(M2),
  750:     B2 = <<B1/binary,B20/binary>>,
  751:     try_read_file(AbsName2, {ok,B2}, filesync_rep_int()),
  752: 
  753:     {error,_} = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{file=>RelName2}),
  754:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{file=>AbsName2}),
  755:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
  756:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE,config,#{file=>RelName2}),
  757:     ok.
  758: relative_file_path(cleanup,_Config) ->
  759:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  760: 
  761: 
  762: sync(Config) ->
  763:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir,Config),
  764:     Log = filename:join(Dir, lists:concat([?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"])),
  765:     Type = {file,Log},
  766:     ok = logger:add_handler(?MODULE,
  767:                             logger_std_h,
  768:                             #{config => #{type => Type,
  769:                                           file_check => 10000},
  770:                               filter_default=>log,
  771:                               filters=>?DEFAULT_HANDLER_FILTERS([?MODULE]),
  772:                               formatter=>{?MODULE,nl}}),
  773: 
  774:     %% check repeated filesync happens
  775:     start_tracer([{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, 2},
  776:                   {file, datasync, 1}],
  777:                  [{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, <<"first\n">>},
  778:                   {file,datasync}]),
  779: 
  780:     logger:notice("first", ?domain),
  781:     %% wait for automatic filesync
  782:     check_tracer(filesync_rep_int()*2),
  783: 
  784:     %% check that explicit filesync is only done once
  785:     start_tracer([{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, 2},
  786:                   {file, datasync, 1}],
  787:                  [{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, <<"second\n">>},
  788:                   {file,datasync},
  789:                   {no_more,500}
  790:                  ]),
  791:     logger:notice("second", ?domain),
  792:     %% do explicit sync
  793:     logger_std_h:filesync(?MODULE),
  794:     %% a second sync should be ignored
  795:     logger_std_h:filesync(?MODULE),
  796:     check_tracer(100),
  797: 
  798:     %% check that if there's no repeated filesync active,
  799:     %% a filesync is still performed when handler goes idle
  800:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  801:                                       #{filesync_repeat_interval => no_repeat}),
  802:     no_repeat = maps:get(filesync_repeat_interval,
  803:                          maps:get(cb_state, logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()))),
  804:     start_tracer([{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, 2},
  805:                   {file, datasync, 1}],
  806:                  [{logger_std_h, write_to_dev, <<"third\n">>},
  807:                   {file,datasync},
  808:                   {logger_std_h, write_to_dev, <<"fourth\n">>},
  809:                   {file,datasync}]),
  810:     logger:notice("third", ?domain),
  811:     %% wait for automatic filesync
  812:     timer:sleep(?IDLE_DETECT_TIME*2),
  813:     logger:notice("fourth", ?domain),
  814:     %% wait for automatic filesync
  815:     timer:sleep(?IDLE_DETECT_TIME*2),
  816: 
  817:     check_tracer(1000),
  818: 
  819:     %% switch repeated filesync on and verify that the looping works
  820:     SyncInt = 1000,
  821:     WaitT = 4500,
  822:     OneSync = {logger_h_common,handle_info,{timeout,repeated_filesync}},
  823:     %% receive 1 repeated_filesync per sec
  824:     start_tracer([{{logger_h_common,handle_info,2},
  825:                    [{[{timeout,'_',repeated_filesync},'_'],[],[]}]}],
  826:                  [OneSync || _ <- lists:seq(1, trunc(WaitT/SyncInt))]),
  827: 
  828:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  829:                                       #{filesync_repeat_interval => SyncInt}),
  830:     SyncInt = maps:get(filesync_repeat_interval,
  831:                        maps:get(cb_state,logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()))),
  832:     timer:sleep(WaitT),
  833:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, config,
  834:                                       #{filesync_repeat_interval => no_repeat}),
  835:     check_tracer(100),
  836:     ok.
  837: sync(cleanup, _Config) ->
  838:     stop_clear(),
  839:     logger:remove_handler(?MODULE).
  840: 
  841: write_failure(Config) ->
  842:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  843:     File = lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"]),
  844:     Log = filename:join(Dir, File),
  845:     {Peer, Node} = start_std_h_on_new_node(Config, Log),
  846:     false = (undefined == rpc:call(Node, ets, whereis, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB])),
  847:     rpc:call(Node, ets, insert, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB,{tester,self()}]),
  848:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_internal_log, [?MODULE,internal_log]),
  849:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_write,ok]),
  850: 
  851:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged1"),
  852:     rpc:call(Node, logger_std_h, filesync, [?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  853:     ?check_no_log,
  854:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,<<"Logged1\n">>}, filesync_rep_int()),
  855: 
  856:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_write,{error,terminated}]),
  857:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  858: 
  859:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,write,Log,{error,terminated}}}),
  860: 
  861:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "No second error printout"),
  862:     ?check_no_log,
  863: 
  864:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_write,{error,eacces}]),
  865:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  866:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,write,Log,{error,eacces}}}),
  867: 
  868:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_write,ok]),
  869:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged2"),
  870:     rpc:call(Node, logger_std_h, filesync, [?STANDARD_HANDLER]),
  871:     ?check_no_log,
  872:     try_read_file(Log, {ok,<<"Logged1\nLogged2\n">>}, filesync_rep_int()),
  873:     peer:stop(Peer).
  874: 
  875: sync_failure(Config) ->
  876:     Dir = ?config(priv_dir, Config),
  877:     File = lists:concat([?MODULE,"_",?FUNCTION_NAME,".log"]),
  878:     Log = filename:join(Dir, File),
  879:     {Peer, Node} = start_std_h_on_new_node(Config, Log),
  880:     false = (undefined == rpc:call(Node, ets, whereis, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB])),
  881:     rpc:call(Node, ets, insert, [?TEST_HOOKS_TAB,{tester,self()}]),
  882:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_internal_log, [?MODULE,internal_log]),
  883:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_datasync,ok]),
  884:     
  885:     SyncInt = 500,
  886:     ok = rpc:call(Node, logger, update_handler_config,
  887:                   [?STANDARD_HANDLER, config,
  888:                    #{filesync_repeat_interval => SyncInt}]),
  889:     
  890:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged1"),
  891:     ?check_no_log,
  892: 
  893:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_datasync,{error,terminated}]),
  894:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  895:     
  896:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,filesync,Log,{error,terminated}}}),
  897: 
  898:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "No second error printout"),
  899:     ?check_no_log,
  900: 
  901:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_datasync,{error,eacces}]),
  902:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Cause simple error printout"),
  903:     ?check({error,{?STANDARD_HANDLER,filesync,Log,{error,eacces}}}),
  904: 
  905:     rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, set_result, [file_datasync,ok]),
  906:     ok = log_on_remote_node(Node, "Logged2"),
  907:     ?check_no_log,
  908:     peer:stop(Peer).
  909: 
  910: start_std_h_on_new_node(Config, Log) ->
  911:     {ok,_,Peer,Node} =
  912:         logger_test_lib:setup(
  913:           Config,
  914:           [{logger,[{handler,default,logger_std_h,
  915:                      #{ config => #{ type => {file,Log}}}}]}]),
  916:     ok = rpc:call(Node,logger,set_handler_config,[?STANDARD_HANDLER,formatter,
  917:                                                   {?MODULE,nl}]),
  918:     {Peer, Node}.
  919: 
  920: %% functions for test hook macros to be called by rpc
  921: set_internal_log(_Mod, _Func) ->
  922:     ?set_internal_log({_Mod,_Func}).
  923: set_result(_Op, _Result) ->
  924:     ?set_result(_Op, _Result).
  925: set_defaults() ->
  926:     ?set_defaults().
  927: 
  928: %% internal log function that sends the term to the test case process
  929: internal_log(Type, Term) ->
  930:     [{tester,Tester}] = ets:lookup(?TEST_HOOKS_TAB, tester),
  931:     Tester ! {log,{Type,Term}},
  932:     logger:internal_log(Type, Term),
  933:     ok.
  934: 
  935: 
  936: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  937: %%% Overload protection tests
  938: 
  939: op_switch_to_sync_file(Config) ->
  940:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
  941:     NumOfReqs = 500,
  942:     NewHConfig =
  943:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
  944:                                        drop_mode_qlen => NumOfReqs+1,
  945:                                        flush_qlen => 2*NumOfReqs,
  946:                                        burst_limit_enable => false}},
  947:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
  948:     %%    TRecvPid = start_op_trace(),
  949:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
  950:     Lines = count_lines(Log),
  951:     %% true = analyse_trace(TRecvPid,
  952:     %%                      fun(Events) -> find_mode(async,Events) end),
  953:     %% true = analyse_trace(TRecvPid,
  954:     %%                      fun(Events) -> find_mode(sync,Events) end),
  955:     %% true = analyse_trace(TRecvPid,
  956:     %%                      fun(Events) -> find_switch(async,sync,Events) end),
  957:     %% false = analyse_trace(TRecvPid,
  958:     %%                       fun(Events) -> find_mode(drop,Events) end),
  959:     %% false = analyse_trace(TRecvPid,
  960:     %%                       fun(Events) -> find_mode(flush,Events) end),    
  961:     %%    stop_op_trace(TRecvPid),
  962:     NumOfReqs = Lines,
  963:     ok = file_delete(Log),
  964:     ok.
  965: op_switch_to_sync_file(cleanup, _Config) ->
  966:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
  967: 
  968: op_switch_to_sync_tty(Config) ->
  969:     {HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, standard_io, Config),
  970:     NumOfReqs = 500,
  971:     NewHConfig =
  972:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 3,
  973:                                        drop_mode_qlen => NumOfReqs+1,
  974:                                        flush_qlen => 2*NumOfReqs,
  975:                                        burst_limit_enable => false}},
  976:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
  977:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
  978:     ok.
  979: op_switch_to_sync_tty(cleanup, _Config) ->
  980:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
  981: 
  982: op_switch_to_drop_file() ->
  983:     [{timetrap,{seconds,180}}].
  984: op_switch_to_drop_file(Config) ->
  985:     Test =
  986:         fun() ->
  987:                 {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} =
  988:                     start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
  989:                 NumOfReqs = 300,
  990:                 Procs = 2,
  991:                 Bursts = 10,
  992:                 NewHConfig =
  993:                     HConfig#{config =>
  994:                                  StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
  995:                                              drop_mode_qlen => 2,
  996:                                              flush_qlen =>
  997:                                                  Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts,
  998:                                              burst_limit_enable => false}},
  999:                 ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1000:                 %% It sometimes happens that the handler gets the
 1001:                 %% requests in a slow enough pace so that dropping
 1002:                 %% never occurs. Therefore, lets generate a number of
 1003:                 %% bursts to increase the chance of message buildup.
 1004:                 [send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice) ||
 1005:                     _ <- lists:seq(1, Bursts)],
 1006:                 Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1007:                 ok = stop_handler(?MODULE),
 1008:                 ct:pal("Number of messages dropped = ~w (~w)",
 1009:                        [Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts-Logged,Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts]),
 1010:                 true = (Logged < (Procs*NumOfReqs*Bursts)),
 1011:                 true = (Logged > 0),
 1012:                 _ = file_delete(Log),
 1013:                 ok
 1014:         end,
 1015:     %% As it's tricky to get the timing right in only one go, we perform the
 1016:     %% test repeatedly, hoping that will generate a successful result.
 1017:     case repeat_until_ok(Test, 10) of
 1018:         {ok,{Failures,_Result}} ->
 1019:             ct:log("Failed ~w times before success!", [Failures]);
 1020:         {fails,Reason} ->
 1021:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1022:     end.
 1023: op_switch_to_drop_file(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1024:     _ = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1025: 
 1026: op_switch_to_drop_tty(Config) ->
 1027:     {HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, standard_io, Config),
 1028:     NumOfReqs = 300,
 1029:     Procs = 2,
 1030:     NewHConfig =
 1031:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 1,
 1032:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 2,
 1033:                                        flush_qlen =>
 1034:                                            Procs*NumOfReqs+1,
 1035:                                        burst_limit_enable => false}},
 1036:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1037:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1038:     ok.
 1039: op_switch_to_drop_tty(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1040:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1041: 
 1042: op_switch_to_flush_file() ->
 1043:     [{timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
 1044: op_switch_to_flush_file(Config) ->
 1045:     Test =
 1046:         fun() ->
 1047:                 {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} =
 1048:                     start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1049: 
 1050:                 %% NOTE: it's important that both async and sync
 1051:                 %% requests have been queued when the flush happens
 1052:                 %% (verify with coverage of flush_log_requests/2)
 1053: 
 1054:                 NewHConfig =
 1055:                     HConfig#{config =>
 1056:                                  StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
 1057:                                              %% disable drop mode
 1058:                                              drop_mode_qlen => 300,
 1059:                                              flush_qlen => 300,
 1060:                                              burst_limit_enable => false}},    
 1061:                 ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1062:                 NumOfReqs = 1500,
 1063:                 Procs = 10,
 1064:                 Bursts = 10,
 1065:                 %% It sometimes happens that the handler either gets
 1066:                 %% the requests in a slow enough pace so that flushing
 1067:                 %% never occurs, or it gets all messages at once,
 1068:                 %% causing all messages to get flushed (no dropping of
 1069:                 %% sync messages gets tested). Therefore, lets
 1070:                 %% generate a number of bursts to increase the chance
 1071:                 %% of message buildup in some random fashion.
 1072:                 [send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice) ||
 1073:                     _ <- lists:seq(1,Bursts)],
 1074:                 Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1075:                 ok = stop_handler(?MODULE),
 1076:                 ct:pal("Number of messages flushed/dropped = ~w (~w)",
 1077:                        [NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts-Logged,NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts]),
 1078:                 true = (Logged < (NumOfReqs*Procs*Bursts)),
 1079:                 true = (Logged > 0),
 1080:                 _ = file_delete(Log),
 1081:                 ok
 1082:         end,
 1083:     %% As it's tricky to get the timing right in only one go, we perform the
 1084:     %% test repeatedly, hoping that will generate a successful result.
 1085:     case repeat_until_ok(Test, 10) of
 1086:         {ok,{Failures,_Result}} ->
 1087:             ct:log("Failed ~w times before success!", [Failures]);
 1088:         {fails,Reason} ->
 1089:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1090:     end.
 1091: op_switch_to_flush_file(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1092:     _ = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1093: 
 1094: op_switch_to_flush_tty() ->
 1095:     [{timetrap,{minutes,5}}].
 1096: op_switch_to_flush_tty(Config) ->
 1097:     {HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, standard_io, Config),
 1098: 
 1099:     %% it's important that both async and sync requests have been queued
 1100:     %% when the flush happens (verify with coverage of flush_log_requests/2)
 1101: 
 1102:     NewHConfig =
 1103:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
 1104:                                        %% disable drop mode
 1105:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 100,
 1106:                                        flush_qlen => 100,
 1107:                                        burst_limit_enable => false}},
 1108:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1109:     NumOfReqs = 1000,
 1110:     Procs = 100,
 1111:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1112:     ok.
 1113: op_switch_to_flush_tty(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1114:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1115: 
 1116: limit_burst_disabled(Config) ->
 1117:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1118:     NewHConfig =
 1119:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => false,
 1120:                                        burst_limit_max_count => 10,
 1121:                                        burst_limit_window_time => 2000,
 1122:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 200,
 1123:                                        flush_qlen => 300}},
 1124:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1125:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1126:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1127:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1128:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1129:     NumOfReqs = Logged,
 1130:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1131:     ok.
 1132: limit_burst_disabled(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1133:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1134: 
 1135: limit_burst_enabled_one(Config) ->
 1136:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1137:     ReqLimit = 10,
 1138:     NewHConfig =
 1139:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => true,
 1140:                                        burst_limit_max_count => ReqLimit,
 1141:                                        burst_limit_window_time => 2000,
 1142:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 200,
 1143:                                        flush_qlen => 300}},
 1144:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1145:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1146:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1147:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1148:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1149:     ReqLimit = Logged,
 1150:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1151:     ok.
 1152: limit_burst_enabled_one(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1153:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1154: 
 1155: limit_burst_enabled_period(Config) ->
 1156:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1157:     ReqLimit = 10,
 1158:     BurstTWin = 1000,
 1159:     NewHConfig =
 1160:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{burst_limit_enable => true,
 1161:                                        burst_limit_max_count => ReqLimit,
 1162:                                        burst_limit_window_time => BurstTWin,
 1163:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 20000,
 1164:                                        flush_qlen => 20001}},
 1165:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1166: 
 1167:     Windows = 3,
 1168:     Sent = send_burst({t,BurstTWin*Windows}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1169:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1170:     ct:pal("Number of messages sent = ~w~nNumber of messages logged = ~w",
 1171:            [Sent,Logged]),
 1172:     true = (Logged > (ReqLimit*Windows)) andalso
 1173:            (Logged < (ReqLimit*(Windows+2))),
 1174:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1175:     ok.
 1176: limit_burst_enabled_period(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1177:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1178: 
 1179: kill_disabled(Config) ->
 1180:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1181:      NewHConfig =
 1182:         HConfig#{config=>StdHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>false,
 1183:                                      overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1184:                                      overload_kill_mem_size=>100}},
 1185:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1186:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1187:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1188:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1189:     ct:pal("Number of messages logged = ~w", [Logged]),
 1190:     ok = file_delete(Log),
 1191:     true = is_pid(whereis(h_proc_name())),
 1192:     ok.
 1193: kill_disabled(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1194:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1195: 
 1196: qlen_kill_new(Config) ->
 1197:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1198:     Pid0 = whereis(h_proc_name()),
 1199:     {_,Mem0} = process_info(Pid0, memory),
 1200:     RestartAfter = ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
 1201:      NewHConfig =
 1202:         HConfig#{config=>StdHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1203:                                      overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1204:                                      overload_kill_mem_size=>Mem0+50000,
 1205:                                      overload_kill_restart_after=>RestartAfter}},
 1206:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1207:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),
 1208:     NumOfReqs = 100,
 1209:     Procs = 4,
 1210:     send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, {spawn,Procs,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1211:     %% send_burst({n,NumOfReqs}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1212:     receive
 1213:         {'DOWN', MRef, _, _, Info} ->
 1214:            case Info of
 1215:                 {shutdown,{overloaded,QLen,Mem}} ->
 1216:                     ct:pal("Terminated with qlen = ~w, mem = ~w", [QLen,Mem]);
 1217:                 killed ->
 1218:                     ct:pal("Slow shutdown, handler process was killed!", [])
 1219:             end,
 1220:             file_delete(Log),
 1221:             {ok,_} = wait_for_process_up(RestartAfter * 3),
 1222:             ok
 1223:     after
 1224:         5000 ->
 1225:             Info = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1226:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info]),
 1227:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1228:     end.
 1229: qlen_kill_new(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1230:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1231: 
 1232: %% choke the standard handler on remote node to verify the termination
 1233: %% works as expected

 1257:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1258:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),

 1260:     Procs = 4,

 1273:             ok

 1275:         5000 ->

 1288: restart_after() ->
 1289:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
 1290: restart_after(Config) ->
 1291:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1292:      NewHConfig1 =
 1293:         HConfig#{config=>StdHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1294:                                      overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1295:                                      overload_kill_restart_after=>infinity}},
 1296:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig1),
 1297:     MRef1 = erlang:monitor(process, whereis(h_proc_name())),
 1298:     %% kill handler
 1299:     send_burst({n,100}, {spawn,4,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1300:     receive
 1301:         {'DOWN', MRef1, _, _, _Reason1} ->
 1302:             file_delete(Log),
 1303:             error = wait_for_process_up(?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER * 3),
 1304:             ok
 1305:     after
 1306:         5000 ->
 1307:             Info1 = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1308:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info1]),
 1309:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1310:     end,
 1311: 
 1312:     {Log,_,_} = start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1313:     RestartAfter = ?OVERLOAD_KILL_RESTART_AFTER,
 1314: 
 1315:     NewHConfig2 =
 1316:         HConfig#{config=>StdHConfig#{overload_kill_enable=>true,
 1317:                                      overload_kill_qlen=>10,
 1318:                                      overload_kill_restart_after=>RestartAfter}},
 1319:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig2),
 1320:     Pid0 = whereis(h_proc_name()),
 1321:     MRef2 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid0),
 1322:     %% kill handler
 1323:     send_burst({n,100}, {spawn,4,0}, {chars,79}, notice),
 1324:     receive
 1325:         {'DOWN', MRef2, _, _, _Reason2} ->
 1326:             file_delete(Log),
 1327:             {ok,Pid1} = wait_for_process_up(RestartAfter * 3),
 1328:             false = (Pid1 == Pid0),
 1329:             ok
 1330:     after
 1331:         5000 ->
 1332:             Info2 = logger_olp:info(h_proc_name()),
 1333:             ct:pal("Handler state = ~p", [Info2]),
 1334:             ct:fail("Handler not dead! It should not have survived this!")
 1335:     end,
 1336:     ok.
 1337: restart_after(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1338:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1339: 
 1340: %% send handler requests (sync, info, reset, change_config)
 1341: %% during high load to verify that sync, dropping and flushing is
 1342: %% handled correctly.
 1343: handler_requests_under_load() ->
 1344:     [{timetrap,{minutes,3}}].
 1345: handler_requests_under_load(Config) ->
 1346:     {Log,HConfig,StdHConfig} =
 1347:         start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1348:     NewHConfig =
 1349:         HConfig#{config => StdHConfig#{sync_mode_qlen => 2,
 1350:                                        drop_mode_qlen => 1000,
 1351:                                        flush_qlen => 2000,
 1352:                                        burst_limit_enable => false}},
 1353:     ok = logger:update_handler_config(?MODULE, NewHConfig),
 1354:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1355:             fun() -> send_requests(1,[{logger_std_h,filesync,[?MODULE],[]},
 1356:                                       {logger_olp,info,[h_proc_name()],[]},
 1357:                                       {logger_olp,reset,[h_proc_name()],[]},
 1358:                                       {logger,update_handler_config,
 1359:                                        [?MODULE, config,
 1360:                                         #{overload_kill_enable => false}],
 1361:                                        []}])
 1362:             end),
 1363:     Sent = send_burst({t,10000}, seq, {chars,79}, notice),
 1364:     Pid ! {self(),finish},
 1365:     ReqResult = receive {Pid,Result} -> Result end,
 1366:     Logged = count_lines(Log),
 1367:     ct:pal("Number of messages sent = ~w~nNumber of messages logged = ~w",
 1368:            [Sent,Logged]),
 1369:     FindError = fun(Res) ->
 1370:                         [E || E <- Res,
 1371:                               is_tuple(E) andalso (element(1,E) == error)]
 1372:                 end,
 1373:     Errors = [{Func,FindError(Res)} || {_,Func,_,Res} <- ReqResult],
 1374:     NoOfReqs = lists:foldl(fun({_,_,_,Res}, N) -> N + length(Res) end,
 1375:                            0, ReqResult),
 1376:     ct:pal("~w requests made. Errors: ~n~p", [NoOfReqs,Errors]),
 1377:     ok = file_delete(Log).
 1378: handler_requests_under_load(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1379:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1380: 
 1381: recreate_deleted_log(Config) ->
 1382:     {Log,_HConfig,_StdHConfig} =
 1383:         start_handler(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Config),
 1384: 
 1385:     %% Make sure that if we delete the directory it is created
 1386:     [ok = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Log)) || element(1,os:type()) =/= win32],
 1387: 
 1388:     logger:notice("first",?domain),
 1389:     logger_std_h:filesync(?MODULE),
 1390:     ok = file:rename(Log,Log++".old"),
 1391:     logger:notice("second",?domain),
 1392:     logger_std_h:filesync(?MODULE),
 1393:     {ok,<<"first\n">>} = file:read_file(Log++".old"),
 1394:     {ok,<<"second\n">>} = file:read_file(Log),
 1395: 
 1396:     ok.
 1397: recreate_deleted_log(cleanup, _Config) ->
 1398:     ok = stop_handler(?MODULE).
 1399: 
 1400: reopen_changed_log(Config) ->
